title: Wanna know why people will always blame Assassin type of champions?
body:
People will never admit when they got outplayed. Is that simple.
Sad but true.

Sometimes you gotta sit back and say" damn, that dude pulled of some moves, i couldn't react to it"

Instead of: " Yeah gg wp op champ"

Outplaying is what all assassin champs must do in order to be good.
Outplaying also means you need be good at playing them.
It's really easy to say "Oh look Lee Sin is so op wtf", then if you try lee sin yourself without any expewrience you'll see that you cannot do jack, because that's what these type of champs requires.

People do not enjoy fighting champions who are capable of killing you in literally a fraction of a second.
People do not enjoy fighting champions who are capable of killing you as soon as they appear.
People do not enjoy fighting champions who are capable of killing you before you even know what hit you.

What does an assassin do in order to be good? They must hide behind all forms of protection or end up killed. They must wait to strike a weak opponent at their moment of vulnerability. They must then retreat after having killed their target or targets unless the opposition is dead or has fled.

In short, an assassin must be the most hated bully on the playground who goes around terrorizing the children so long as no one is around who can stop them. An assassin must be precisely what the term "assassin" implies. Someone who sneaks around and cuts people down without making their presence known until it's too late.

It's really not hard to understand why people hate assassins. Their hatred has nothing to do with how well a person plays their champion. You can be the best ADC, mage, or even assassin possible, but that won't eliminate a decent assassin's chance of killing you in a split second. That is why people hate them. 

If an assassin is going around killing people instantly or quickly, however, it doesn't really make them over powered. It simply means that the assassin is doing their job and managed to pick up enough kills to empower them.

Fizz - Has waveclear, cc (slow on two abilities and a knockup), and very high survivability through passive and mobility.

Ahri - Has waveclear, cc on charm, and very high survivability through sustain, ms boost, and mobility.

LeBlanc - Has waveclear, cc root, and very high survivability through mobility.

Rengar - Jungle clear speed is pretty good so you can't really say he doesn't clear. CC root/Slow, and pretty good survivability with built in sustain and sometimes a bruiser build.

Diana - Has waveclear, minimal CC through displacement but it still exists, and good survivability through shield and standard build providing some decent defensive stats.

Talon - Has waveclear, pretty minimal short slow  cc, still counts, but poor survivability.

Zed - Has really good waveclear, very minimal cc like Talon through a short slow, and very high survivability through mobility.

Akali - Worst waveclear of the bunch, like Talon and Zed has minimal cc through a slow, she has pretty decent survivability through stealth,  and high levels of built in sustain.

I'm sure I missed some assassins but most of these seem to have all of the above in some amount.
